author: rgerosa
body:
We have developed new trainings for particle-net based on 12X simulated samples in Run3 conditions. This PR contains both models for AK4 jet flavour tagging and AK8 2-prong MD tagging. For each of the two cases, one onnx model for offline (RECO/miniAOD) and one for online (HLT) jets is provided. The HLT version of particle-net are meant to be used in the HH4b dedicated triggers proposed in the trigger review by the Higgs PAG [0]. 

[0] https://indico.cern.ch/event/1099590/contributions/4626739/attachments/2358674/4025770/TSGHIG_03Dec21.pdf

More details:
1. ParticleNetAK4/HLT/V00/ contains models for AK4PF jet tagging at HLT. Two distinct models are proposed: one able to classify b-jet/c-jet/uds-jet/gluon-jets, one adding hadronic tau-jets. In fact, we are studying possible improvements over DeepTau.
2. ParticleNetAK4/HLT/V00/ same networks as point 1. but trained on offline (reco) AK4CHS jets.
3. ParticleNetAK8/MD-2prong/HLT/  contains models for AK8PF 2-prong tagging at HLT (mass decorrelated). Two distinct models are proposed: one able to classify Xbb/Xcc/Xqq/Xgg/QCD, the second adds a Xtautau (hadronic tau) class.
4. ParticleNetAK8/MD-2prong/V02 same network as point 3. but trained on offline AK8Puppi jets.

These models are built starting from already existing particle-net models but training samples, input features, and NN hyper-parameters have been modified/tuned in order to achieve best performance & the possibility of being evaluated on both online and offline jets.

We will open soon another PR into cmssw-master in order merge changes needed for the evaluation. The HLT models will be used in Run3 data-taking. Instead, the RECO ones don't need, for the time being, to replace those used in standard sequences (RECO/MiniAOD). However, we would like to have them shipped as external to future CMSSW releases for testing/studying purposes given that it is always possible easily infere networks using miniAOD collections.
title: Merge ParticleNet AK4 and AK8 models for Run3
